TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IMessageFormatter implements class System.ICloneable

Docs.summary: Serializes or deserializes objects from the body of a Message Queuing message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When an application sends a message to the queue using an instance of the <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueue> class, the formatter serializes the object (which can be an instance of any class) into a stream and inserts it into the message body. When reading from a queue using a <xref:System.Messaging.MessageQueue>, the formatter deserializes the message data into the <xref:System.Messaging.Message.Body%2A> property of a <xref:System.Messaging.Message>.
<xref:System.Messaging.BinaryMessageFormatter> and <xref:System.Messaging.ActiveXMessageFormatter> provide faster throughput than the <xref:System.Messaging.XmlMessageFormatter>. The <xref:System.Messaging.ActiveXMessageFormatter> allows interoperability with Visual Basic 6.0 Message Queuing applications. The <xref:System.Messaging.XmlMessageFormatter> is loosely coupled, which means that the server and client can version the type that is sent and received independently.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CanRead(class System.Messaging.Message message) cil managed

Docs.summary: When implemented in a class, determines whether the formatter can deserialize the contents of the message.
Docs.returns: if the formatter can deserialize the message; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Read(class System.Messaging.Message message) cil managed

Docs.summary: When implemented in a class, reads the contents from the given message and creates an object that contains data from the message.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (System.Messaging.Message message, object obj);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Write(class System.Messaging.Message message, object obj) cil managed

Docs.param: The that will contain the serialized object.
The object to be serialized into the message.
Docs.summary: When implemented in a class, serializes an object into the body of the message.
